title: 114_s2066
content: The "Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act" recognizes infants born alive after an abortion as legal persons entitled to all protections under U.S. laws. These infants have the same rights as any newborn or person seeking medical care in a hospital or clinic. The "Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act" amends Chapter 74 of title 18, United States Code, to include requirements for health care practitioners to provide the same level of care to a child born alive after an abortion as they would to any newborn. The "Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act" mandates that health care practitioners must provide the same level of care to a child born alive after an abortion as they would to any newborn. Failure to comply results in penalties of fines or imprisonment for up to 5 years. Practitioners or employees who witness violations must report them to law enforcement agencies. The "Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act" imposes penalties of fines or up to 5 years imprisonment for intentionally killing a child born alive. The mother of the child cannot be prosecuted under this section, and civil remedies are available for the woman upon whom the abortion was performed. In a civil action against a violator, appropriate relief includes money damages for injuries, statutory damages equal to 3 times the cost of the abortion, and punitive damages. The court will award attorney's fees to the prevailing plaintiff, and if the defendant prevails, attorney's fees may also be awarded. In a civil action, if the court finds the plaintiff's suit frivolous, attorney's fees will be awarded to the defendant. Definitions in this section clarify that abortion involves intentionally killing an unborn child or terminating a pregnancy, except to produce a live birth after viability. The text discusses the definition of abortion, including the intentional killing of an unborn child or terminating a pregnancy to produce a live birth after viability. It also defines "attempt" in relation to abortion as conduct planned to culminate in performing an abortion. Requirements pertaining to born-alive abortion survivors.
